node.title: Svitolina says players who speak out against Russia should be able to play
node.description: Russian and Belarusian players who speak out against Russia's invasion of Ukraine "should be allowed" to compete at Wimbledon, Elina Svitolina says.

node.title: Rising tensions: Parties clash over inflation and spending
node.description: Today's inflation rise cannot be blamed entirely on global effects, National leader Christopher Luxon says, but the finance minister says tax cuts are not the answer.

node.title: Caterer and bride arrested after allegedly lacing reception meal with marijuana
node.description: Many guests at the reception reported feeling extremely ill and high — some were vomiting and requesting to be taken to the hospital.

node.title: Study shows who would benefit most from different forms of student loan relief
node.description: The White House has said a decision on canceling debt would be made between now and the end of August.

node.title: Search continues for fisherman missing since Easter Sunday
node.description: Police are resuming the search for missing fisherman Jason Kauta in eastern Bay of Plenty this morning.

node.title: Three Waitakere Ranges tracks set to re-open after four years
node.description: The Gibbons, Muir and Pararaha Valley tracks will open again, after an upgrade costing two million dollars. Audio

node.title: Family found dead in Minnesota home was apparent murder-suicide, police say
node.description: Officials believe the victims suffered gunshot wounds while they were sleeping in their beds.

node.title: Fauci fears judge's mask ruling could set "dangerous precedent"
node.description: The president's chief medical adviser criticized the "disturbing" decision by "a judge with no experience in public health."

node.title: Ardern celebrates green energy and kiwifruit in Tokyo
node.description: The prime minister and Toyota NZ chief executive launched an Auckland-based hydrogen-fuel ride-sharing scheme from Tokyo today.

node.title: Shanghai Covid-19 lockdown hitting NZ meat exports
node.description: Meat exporters are sending more product to the US to avoid delays at Shanghai Port caused by the city's strict Covid-19 lockdown.

node.title: Invitation-only event for this year's Anzac Day dawn service
node.description: Many formal parades and services have been cancelled due to the Omicron outbreak.

node.title: Govt urged to step in to prevent loss of life in flood-prone areas
node.description: An expert in natural hazard planning says the government needs to buy out residents in flood-prone areas such as Anzac Parade in Whanganui, or risk people losing their lives.

node.title: Macron cements French presidential frontrunner status
node.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has cleared a major hurdle on the path to re-election with a combative TV debate performance against far-right candidate Marine Le Pen.

node.title: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández indicted
node.description: The former Honduran president has been extradited to the U.S. to face weapons and drug trafficking charges.

node.title: Harris' chief of staff Tina Flournoy to exit administration
node.description: "We are done for now" with staff changes, a person familiar with the comings and goings in Harris' office tells CBS News.

node.title: Ex-"Real Housewives" star NeNe Leakes alleges show ignored racist comments
node.description: "NBC, Bravo and True foster a corporate and workplace culture in which racially-insensitive and inappropriate behavior is tolerated – if not, encouraged," the suit says.

node.title: Video appears to show Mike Tyson punching passenger on JetBlue plane
node.description: Representatives for the former boxer said another passenger was being aggressive, which started the incident.

node.title: Judge grants motion to dismiss charges in Suzanne Morphew case
node.description: Barry Morphew says he was shooting chipmunks. Investigators believe he was hunting his wife Suzanne with a tranquilizer gun.

node.title: Jose Ramos-Horta declares victory in Timor-Leste presidential election
node.description: Independence leader and Nobel laureate Jose Ramos-Horta has declared victory in Timor-Leste's presidential election, saying he would work to foster unity.

node.title: Lack of construction trainees may lead to infrastructure delays - report
node.description: A lack of training for new civil construction workers could create delays and cost over-runs for billions of dollars of roading and infrastructure projects.

node.title: Why the transition into adolescence can be brutal for kids' mental health
node.description: Addressing how we treat teen mental health is of increasing importance with rising rates of anxiety and depression in teens and the likely impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, writes clinical psychologist…

node.title: Florida woman gets jail time for trying to hire a hitman on the dark web
node.description: The woman has been sentenced to 6 and a half years in prison.

node.title: France prepares for landmark presidential election
node.description: The latest opinion polls suggest incumbent president Emmanuel Macron has a six- to 13-point lead over his rival, far-right leader Marine Le Pen.

node.title: Aquamation, composting offer eco-friendly burial options
node.description: In the three states where body composting is legal, people can have their remains give back to the Earth as their final act.

node.title: Ferrari fans to celebrate F1 homecoming
node.description: Ferrari fans will be hoping to celebrate a triumphant homecoming at Imola after Charles Leclerc's early season domination raised expectations to the highest levels in years. The massed ranks of...

node.title: 'Vintage back to normal': Winegrowers hopeful of refilling cellars
node.description: There are promising signs of a much better grape harvest in the wake of a disappointing experience last year.

node.title: Stephen Colbert tests positive for COVID-19
node.description: New episodes of "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" are set to return on May 2.

node.title: Satellite images appear to show new mass graves outside Mariupol
node.description: The imagery shows long rows of graves stretching away from an existing cemetery in the town of Manhush, some 12 miles from Mariupol.

node.title: Larry Nassar victims seek $130 million from FBI over bungled investigation
node.description: "This was not a case involving fake 20 dollar bills or tax cheats," one attorney said. "These were allegations of a serial rapist who was known to the FBI as the Olympic U.S. doctor with unfettered access to young women."

node.title: Best Buy recalls 772K air fryers after more than 100 catch fire
node.description: Product sold across the U.S. and Canada can overheat, and has been linked to minor property damage and two injuries.
